docs.snippet: The United States sent the first installment of $1.7 billion to Iran to settle a financial dispute at the same time Iran released American prisoners....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States sent the first installment of $1.7 billion to Iran to settle a financial dispute at the same time Iran released American prisoners.
docs.abstract: Q&A discusses controversy surrounding $400 million cash payment by United States government to Iran in January 2016; revelation of payment has been cause of contention over whether it was tied to release of four Americans who had been detained by Iran.

headline.print_headline: Questions About the Curious Timing of U.S. Paying Iran

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and DAVID E. SANGER

docs.snippet: Imagine being a fly on the wall at his first intelligence briefing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Imagine being a fly on the wall at his first intelligence briefing.
docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column imagines how Republican presidential candidate Donald J Trump might handle pre-election classified  intelligence briefing traditionally received by each party's nominee.

headline.main: Donald Trump and a C.I.A. Officer Walk Into a Room

docs.snippet: Mr. Pence openly split with his running mate a day after Mr. Trump said he was not ready to endorse Mr. Ryan....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Pence openly split with his running mate a day after Mr. Trump said he was not ready to endorse Mr. Ryan.
docs.abstract: Indiana Gov Mike Pence endorses House Speaker Paul D Ryan's re-election bid day after running mate Donald Trump said he was not ready to endorse Ryan; split between Republican presidential candidate and his vice presidential pick over speaker of Republican-dominated House of Representatives is indicative of rift that still exists in party.

headline.main: Mike Pence Splits With Donald Trump on Paul Ryan Endorsement
headline.print_headline: Pence Supports Ryan, Showing G.O.P. Turmoil

byline.contributor: Patrick Healy and Noah Remnick contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER, MAGGIE HABERMAN and JONATHAN MARTIN

docs.snippet: Donald Trump's warning that the November election might be rigged is "ridiculous," President Barack Obama declared on Thursday, wading deeper into the 2016 campaign. Anxious Republicans, meanwhile, struggled to move attention from their own infigh...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump's warning that the November election might be rigged is "ridiculous," President Barack Obama declared on Thursday, wading deeper into the 2016 campaign. Anxious Republicans, meanwhile, struggled to move attention from their own infighting to Democratic foe Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Trump Conflict Overshadows Attacks on Clinton Foreign Policy
headline.print_headline: Trump Conflict Overshadows Attacks on Clinton Foreign Policy

docs.snippet: Groups of wealthy Republicans unhappy with Donald Trump have been privately courting prominent peers to join them in backing Democrat Hillary Clinton's U.S. presidential bid, several people involved in the effort told Reuters....
docs.lead_paragraph: Groups of wealthy Republicans unhappy with Donald Trump have been privately courting prominent peers to join them in backing Democrat Hillary Clinton's U.S. presidential bid, several people involved in the effort told Reuters.

headline.main: In Slap at Trump, Some Wealthy Republicans Campaign for Clinton
headline.print_headline: In Slap at Trump, Some Wealthy Republicans Campaign for Clinton

headline.main: Investor Wilbur Ross Urges Trump Not to Let His Behavior Become the Issue

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama confirmed on Thursday that Donald Trump will get national security briefings ahead of the November election, but he warned the Republican candidate, whom he has called "unfit" for office, that information from the meetings m...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama confirmed on Thursday that Donald Trump will get national security briefings ahead of the November election, but he warned the Republican candidate, whom he has called "unfit" for office, that information from the meetings must be kept secret.

headline.main: Obama Warns Trump Not to Spread Details of Security Briefings
headline.print_headline: Obama Warns Trump Not to Spread Details of Security Briefings

docs.snippet: Hoping to capitalize on the criticism battering Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton has begun portraying support for her candidacy as a patriotic duty of voters. She's broadening her message and appealing directly to Republicans to keep him out of the W...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hoping to capitalize on the criticism battering Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton has begun portraying support for her candidacy as a patriotic duty of voters. She's broadening her message and appealing directly to Republicans to keep him out of the White House.

headline.main: Clinton Wooing a New Group of Voters: Republicans
headline.print_headline: Clinton Wooing a New Group of Voters: Republicans
